page.title: 05CROPS-SUGAR BEET & POTATOES
page.content:
{SUGAR BEET}is grown on 18/20 inch rows, sown accurately at about 6 inch spacing, sprayed for weed and applied control and finaly lifted by a 3 row harvesting machine which lifts tops, cleans and delivers into a trailor. The beet which has a sugar content of around 16% is delivered to the factory at{Brigg}for processing, eventually into{lump sugar.
{POTATOES}are often picked by hand as the stones in the land may cause damage if lifted by machine. On stone free land a harvester is used and the crop is usually stored for sale at intervals during the winter. Sprays are used to combat weeds and diseases particularly{potato blight}and a {sprout suppresant}is used during storage.
